001package net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.loss;
002
003import net.tvburger.jdl.common.numbers.JavaNumberTypeSupport;
004import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.Decorator;
005import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.Strategy;
006
007import java.util.List;
008
009/**
010 * A decorator loss function that applies a fixed scaling factor
011 * to the results of another loss function.
012 *
013 * <p>
014 * {@code ScaledError} can operate at multiple levels of loss
015 * calculation — dimension, sample, and batch — by delegating to
016 * an underlying {@link LossFunction} and scaling its results by
017 * a constant multiplier.
018 * </p>
019 *
020 * <p>
021 * For example, when wrapping a {@link SquaredError} with a scaling
022 * factor of {@code 0.5}, this class produces the commonly used
023 * Mean Squared Error (MSE) formulation:
024 * <pre>
025 * MSE = 0.5 * (predicted - target)^2
026 * </pre>
027 */
028@Decorator
029@Strategy(Strategy.Role.CONCRETE)
030public class ScaledError<N extends Number> implements DimensionLossFunction<N>, SampleLossFunction<N>, BatchLossFunction<N> {
031
032    private final JavaNumberTypeSupport<N> typeSupport;
033    private final N scale;
034    private final LossFunction<N> lossFunction;
035
036    /**
037     * Creates a new {@code ScaledError} that decorates the given
038     * {@link LossFunction} with a scaling factor.
039     *
040     * @param scale        the factor by which to scale the computed loss values
041     * @param lossFunction the underlying {@link LossFunction} to decorate
042     */
043    public ScaledError(JavaNumberTypeSupport<N> typeSupport, N scale, LossFunction<N> lossFunction) {
044        this.typeSupport = typeSupport;
045        this.scale = scale;
046        this.lossFunction = lossFunction;
047    }
048
049    /**
050     * {@inheritDoc}
051     */
052    @Override
053    public N calculateBatchLoss(List<N> sampleLosses) {
054        return typeSupport.multiply(((BatchLossFunction<N>) lossFunction).calculateBatchLoss(sampleLosses), scale);
055    }
056
057    /**
058     * {@inheritDoc}
059     */
060    @Override
061    public N calculateGradient_dJ_dL(int batchSize) {
062        return typeSupport.multiply(((BatchLossFunction<N>) lossFunction).calculateGradient_dJ_dL(batchSize), scale);
063    }
064
065    /**
066     * {@inheritDoc}
067     */
068    @Override
069    public N calculateDimensionLoss(N estimated, N target) {
070        return typeSupport.multiply(((DimensionLossFunction<N>) lossFunction).calculateDimensionLoss(estimated, target), scale);
071    }
072
073    /**
074     * {@inheritDoc}
075     */
076    @Override
077    public N calculateGradient_dl_da(N estimated, N target) {
078        return typeSupport.multiply(((DimensionLossFunction<N>) lossFunction).calculateGradient_dl_da(estimated, target), scale);
079    }
080
081    /**
082     * {@inheritDoc}
083     */
084    @Override
085    public N calculateSampleLoss(List<N> dimensionLosses) {
086        return typeSupport.multiply(((SampleLossFunction<N>) lossFunction).calculateSampleLoss(dimensionLosses), scale);
087    }
088
089    /**
090     * {@inheritDoc}
091     */
092    @Override
093    public N calculateGradient_dL_dl(int dimensions) {
094        return typeSupport.multiply(((SampleLossFunction<N>) lossFunction).calculateGradient_dL_dl(dimensions), scale);
095    }
096
097    /**
098     * {@inheritDoc}
099     */
100    @Override
101    public JavaNumberTypeSupport<N> getNumberTypeSupport() {
102        return typeSupport;
103    }
104}
